boundedMaxSum
Class InstanceCloner

java.lang.Object
  boundedMaxSum.InstanceCloner

public class InstanceCloner
extends java.lang.Object

Class to clone a COP problem instance. It ask for the original instance, and keep a pointer to the originale and to the cloned one. Example of use: COP_Instance cop = new MS_COP_Instance(path_to_file); InstanceCloner ic = new InstanceCloner(cop); COP_Instance cop_cloned = ic.getClonedInstance(); // do whatever you like on cop_cloned, like solving it // now it's time to set the original variables with to the values computed ic.setOriginalVariablesValues(); // ok, you're ready to evaluate original instance System.out.println("Utility is: " + cop.actualValue()

Author:
Michele Roncalli

setOriginalVariablesValues

public boolean setOriginalVariablesValues()
                                   throws VariableNotSetException,
                                          NodeVariableNotInMapException
It updates the values of the original instance variables with respect to the cloned instance ones

Returns:
true if everything goes right
Throws:
VariableNotSetException - if at least one of the original instance variable is not set
NodeVariableNotInMapException - if at least one of the cloned instance variable has no entry in the current map pointing its original instance variable

Only for test. Setting debug to 3 should be better.

Returns:
a string representing the three hashmap used by this cloner
